result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William C. Bearder

records.addlTxt:
2:55 PM
Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person. Clerk Dana A.  Minutes: Defendant will retain his own counsel. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm. Atty status. Bond continued as previously set. ec
Adjourned initial appearance on December 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on October 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant, William C. Bearder, appeared.  Attorney Emily K. Gaertner appeared for the Prosecution.   Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE is attempting to retain private.    DE waives time for preliminary hearing.  Bond continued.   Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.  No drug paraphenalia.

01:26 PM    Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Joseph Cocoran.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on 9/1/22 @ 930am. $1000  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event). DE not eligible for SPD if released. DE given advocate counsel paperwork today. ec
and witness list filed by the State
